page.title: 14Calf Rearing &Sheep Shearing
page.content: Mr Ross (the farmer) owns about 80 calves. The calves start in Somerset where they are born,then at 6 weeks of age they go to a calf rearer who feeds them milk,pellets,hay and water.At this point they are all kept in pens but on the last week they are freed and are then put into one large pen and the milk is stopped . At 9 weeks of age they come to Mr Ross.They are once again put into one big pen and are fed pellets, hay and water. The sheep in the farm are not owned by Mr Ross but by his son Brian. Mr Ross did own some sheep but recently sold them. The sheep were sheared about a week ago. The Rosses hire qualified people to do this work, it takes about 3 hours as there are only 50 sheep and 20 lambs, but only the biggest lambs are sheared. Mr Ross takes great pride in rearing his animals.
